trans-unit.source: Enables a named pipe server process to wait for a client process to connect

seg-source.mrk: Enables a named pipe server process to wait for a client process to connect

target.mrk: Enables a named pipe server process to wait for a client process to connect

trans-unit.source: Handle to the server end of a named pipe instance

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the server end of a named pipe instance

target.mrk: Handle to the server end of a named pipe instance

trans-unit.source: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, $pOverlapped must not be 0.

seg-source.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, $pOverlapped must not be 0.

target.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, $pOverlapped must not be 0.

trans-unit.source: If $hNamedPipe was created with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED and $pOverlapped is not 0, the $tagOVERLAPPED structure should contain a handle to a manual reset event object.

seg-source.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was created with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED and $pOverlapped is not 0, the $tagOVERLAPPED structure should contain a handle to a manual reset event object.

target.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was created with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED and $pOverlapped is not 0, the $tagOVERLAPPED structure should contain a handle to a manual reset event object.

trans-unit.source: If $hNamedPipe was not opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, the function does not return until a client is connected or an error occurs.

seg-source.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was not opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, the function does not return until a client is connected or an error occurs.

target.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was not opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, the function does not return until a client is connected or an error occurs.

trans-unit.source: Successful synchronous operations result in the function returning a nonzero value if a client connects after the function is called.

seg-source.mrk: Successful synchronous operations result in the function returning a nonzero value if a client connects after the function is called.

target.mrk: Successful synchronous operations result in the function returning a nonzero value if a client connects after the function is called.

trans-unit.source: If a client connects before the function is called, the function returns zero and GetLastError will return $ERROR_PIPE_CONNECTED (defined in APIErrorsConstants.au3).

seg-source.mrk: If a client connects before the function is called, the function returns zero and GetLastError will return $ERROR_PIPE_CONNECTED (defined in APIErrorsConstants.au3).

target.mrk: If a client connects before the function is called, the function returns zero and GetLastError will return $ERROR_PIPE_CONNECTED (defined in APIErrorsConstants.au3).

trans-unit.source: This can happen if a client connects in the interval between the call to CreateNamedPipe and the call to ConnectNamedPipe.

seg-source.mrk: This can happen if a client connects in the interval between the call to CreateNamedPipe and the call to ConnectNamedPipe.

target.mrk: This can happen if a client connects in the interval between the call to CreateNamedPipe and the call to ConnectNamedPipe.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, there is a good connection between client and server even though the function returns zero.

seg-source.mrk: In this situation, there is a good connection between client and server even though the function returns zero.

target.mrk: In this situation, there is a good connection between client and server even though the function returns zero.
